title: Is there any hope without college? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. You’re probably asking “Is there any hope for me without college?” And yes, there definitely is. You don’t need college to learn skills. In the U.S.A. college is something so ingrained in our society that many kids go right after high school despite not having any idea about what they want to do. It’s a great way to waste 80k+ over the course of 4 years. Figure out what you want to do in life. If you need to get a job in the meantime to pay bills and survive don’t let that job take over your life. Set aside time to think about your future and figure out what you need to do to get there. Also, live frugally so that when you figure out what you want to do, you can begin to freely navigate towards it. Trying to escape debt then get to what we want is difficult. Debt starts to dominate our thinking because it is scary.

Education is a cage lowered around truth that if it is taught & learned very well allows tons of truth to escape between the bars. Do an aptitude test & see where your abilities lie. For certain professions college is necessary but to use your aptitude for them in other areas is always possible. The crowning glory of the human intellect that makes us better and/or worse than all other life forms - the imagination. In applied form known as creativity to see the beauty in all things you wish to accomplish. You’re going to have to decide to leverage it & be exploratory. If you mean make a lot of money thee are tons of professions needing people that don’t require college that are extremely lucrative. Working with your hands is extremely noble in all sorts of ways & far healthier then sitting behind a desk. Plumbers, electricians, construction contractors & so much more.
